subject: Design
title: Raymond Loewy: The Man Who Shaped America
description: A micro-lesson that makes Raymond Loewy: The Man Who Shaped America usable.

hook.text: One man designed the Shell logo, Lucky Strike pack, Air Force One, and the Greyhound bus. His name was Raymond Loewy.

buildup.text: A French immigrant, Loewy arrived in New York in 1919 with $40 and a talent for making ugly things beautiful.

discovery.text: His philosophy: MAYA â€” Most Advanced Yet Acceptable. Push design forward, but not so far people reject it.

twist.text: Loewy didn't invent products. He redesigned existing ones to sell better â€” the first pure industrial designer.

climax.text: Loewy proved that how something looks is as important as how it works. Design became a business tool.

punchline.text: The father of industrial design started by redesigning a pencil sharpener.

quiz.question: What was Raymond Loewy's MAYA principle?
